intro: Oenothera octolineata, commonly known as the four-line evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces long, slender seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oenothera octolineata is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its adaptability to harsh conditions.
